page.title: 06HONLEY JUNIOR SCHOOL GAMES
page.content: There are a number of {games }that children play in the {schoolyard.}One of these games is "Chains-Up" in which somebody is 'on' and they have to catch the others. Once they have caught someone they have to hold hands and try to catch someone else. Probably the most well known game is "Hide and Seek". One of the people has to close his eyes and count to a certain number whilst the others go and hide. Then the person who has been counting has to go and find the other people who have been hiding. "Chase" is another well known game. It is rather like "Chains-Up", except when you are caught you do not have to hold hands. Other games, such as "Knives, Forks and Spoons", "Hopscotch" and "Skipping" are popular with the youngsters.
